citeulike_paper.title: Efficient Crawling Through URL Ordering
citeulike_paper.abstract: In this paper we study in what order a crawler should visit the URLs it has seen, in order to obtain more ￃﾢimportantￃﾢ pages first. Obtaining important pages rapidly can be very useful when a crawler cannot visit the entire Web in a reasonable amount of time. We define several importance metrics, ordering schemes, and performance evaluation measures for this problem. We also experimentally evaluate the ordering schemes on the Stanford University Web. Our results show that a crawler with a good ordering scheme can obtain important pages significantly faster than one without.

source.title: In COMPUTER NETWORKS AND ISDN SYSTEMS (1998), pp. 161-172ￂﾠ Key: citeulike:11486689
